page.title: 11 YE OLDE STAR PUBLIC HOUSE.
page.content: The star is a clean sandstone built house with a restaurant,which holds 50 people,situated at Cotton Cross Roads. There are snooker and pool tables with arcade games in the childrens room.The publicans are Mr.and Mrs.Morgan who have only been there for one month.The building is 425 years old.There are lots of old horse brasses and brass jugs on display in the rooms.The cost of a pint of beer is 68p and the cost of a nip of whisky is 62p.The beer is delivered in barrels at least twice a week and is stored in the cellar which holds 35 barrells.The many cases of wines and spirits are stored in a room. They have about 100 people coming here everyday.
